question: In the management of stores VED, D stands for:
exp: VED ANALYSIS Vital drugs: Items whose absence cannot be tolerated (10% of total items). Essential drugs: Items whose absence can be tolerated for some time (40% of total items). Desirable drugs: Items whose absence can be tolerated for long time (50% of total items). ALSO REMEMBER ABC analysis: Always better control. SDE analysis: Scarce - Difficult - Easy availability. FSN analysis: Fast moving - Slow moving - Non moving.

question: Measurement of output in terms of results achieved is:-
exp: Cost effective analysis: A management technique where benefits are expressed in terms of results achieved, e. g., number of lives saved or number of days free from disease; It is a more promising tool than cost benefit analysis in the health field. Most comprehensive indicator of CEA: Quality adjusted life years (QALYs) gained. Quality adjusted life years (QALYs)- Number of years of life that would be added by intervention. Cost benefit analysis: Output of a programme is in monetary terms. Eg: RNTCP-2018 saved 40 M US $. System analysis: Comparision of 2/more cost effective alternatives in a health programme. Network analysis: Is the graphic plan of all events and activities to be completed in order to reach end objective. Two common types of network techniques are: PE - Sequence of activities in a health programme to plan, schedule, monitor & furnish timely repos. Critical path: Total duration of activities which is longer.

question: A specific pre-planned activity in a Health Program is known as:-
exp: Objective: Is pre-planned end-point of all activities; Is precise and 'specific'. Is either achieved or not achieved. Is concerned with the problem itself. Target: A discrete activity which helps measure the extent of attainment of objectives; Is a 'concept of degree of achievement' of objective with a time line. Goal: Ultimate desired state 'towards which objectives and resources are directed; shows all or none phenomenon' and on related social and economic development. Impact: Is an expression of the positive effects of a programme, services or the institution on the overall health development and on related social and economic development.

question: Not a feature of Cost accounting is:-
exp: Cost accounting: A quantitative management technique which provides basic data on cost structure of any programme. Is based on: Cost control. Planning and allocation of people and financial services. Pricing of cost reimbursement.
opb: Planning and allocation of people and financial services

question: The management technique which is more promising tool for application in health field is:-
exp: Cost Effective Analysis - This is a more promising tool for application in health field than cost benefit analysis It is similar to cost benefit analysis except that benefit, instead of being expressed in Monetary terms is expressed in terms of Results achieved eg - No. of lives saved or No. of days free from disease

question: The 3 major divisions of Planning Commission are all Except:-
exp: PLANNING COMMISSION OF INDIA:- Set up by Government of India in 1950. Consists of: Chairman Deputy chairman 5 members. 3 major divisions: General secretariat Technical divisions Programme advisors.
